metadata.title: CVE-2017-14314 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Off-by-one error in the DrawImage function in magick/render.c inGraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(DrawDashPolygon heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via acrafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-10
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-10
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-10
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-10
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-10').
